def_cn: 没听到的；不被理睬的；被忽略的
def_en: If you say that a person or their words go unheard, you are expressing criticism because someone refuses to pay attention to what is said or take it into consideration.

def_cn: 不为人知的；前所未闻的
def_en: If you describe spoken comments or pieces of music as unheard, you mean that most people are not familiar with them because they have not been expressed or performed in public.
If someone's words or cries go unheard, nobody can hear them, or a particular person cannot hear them.
